skill.name: web-navigation
skill.description: Navigation and routing patterns for React web applications. Use when implementing React Router, Next.js routing, deep links, or handling navigation state.
skill.summary: Navigation and routing patterns for React web applications. Use when implementing React Router, Next...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with React Router and Next.js code examples. The static scanner flagged 62 false positives triggered by TypeScript template literals (backticks in code blocks), routing terminology, and URL patterns being misinterpreted as security threats. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external command execution exists in this skill.

content.value_statement: Building React applications requires proper routing and navigation patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use code examples for React Router v6 and Next.js App Router including nested routes, dynamic segments, and programmatic navigation.
actual_capabilities: React Router v6 setup with BrowserRouter, Routes, and Route components
Next.js App Router file-based routing patterns
Dynamic route parameters with useParams and useSearchParams
Programmatic navigation with useNavigate and router.push
Navigation guards for protected routes and unsaved changes
limitations: Contains only documentation and code examples - no runtime execution
Does not include complete working application code
Focuses on client-side routing patterns only

use_cases.title: Build React navigation
use_cases.description: Implement navigation architecture in React applications using React Router or Next.js

use_cases.title: Add deep linking support
use_cases.description: Create shareable URLs with dynamic parameters and query strings for React applications

use_cases.title: Structure route hierarchies
use_cases.description: Design nested layouts and shared navigation components for React applications

prompt_templates.title: Basic routing setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to set up basic routing with React Router v6 including a home page, about page, and 404 fallback

prompt_templates.title: Dynamic routes
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create dynamic routes in Next.js App Router that capture URL parameters like /users/:id

prompt_templates.title: Nested layouts
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a nested route structure in React Router with a dashboard layout containing sidebar and child routes

prompt_templates.title: Navigation guards
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement navigation guards to protect routes that require authentication in React Router

output_examples.input: Set up React Router with nested routes for a dashboard
output: â€¢ DashboardLayout contains shared Sidebar and Outlet for children
â€¢ Nested routes use path='settings' (relative to parent)
â€¢ NavLink provides automatic active styling via className callback

output_examples.input: Create dynamic route for user profiles in Next.js
output: â€¢ Access params.id for user identifier
â€¢ Optional searchParams for query filtering
â€¢ generateStaticParams for static generation at build time

output_examples.input: Implement navigation guard for unsaved changes
output: â€¢ useBlocker hook monitors navigation attempts
â€¢ Check currentLocation vs nextLocation when isDirty
â€¢ blocker.proceed() allows navigation, blocker.reset() cancels
â€¢ Dialog component handles user confirmation

best_practices: Use URL parameters instead of component state for shareable deep links
Implement loading and error boundaries for async route data
Use navigation guards to prevent unsaved form data loss
anti_patterns: Using window.location for navigation instead of router.navigate
Storing critical application state that should survive page refresh
Forgetting scroll restoration for single-page applications

faq.question: Does this skill work with both React Router and Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides patterns for React Router v6 and Next.js App Router with code examples for each.

faq.question: What versions of React Router are supported?
faq.answer: The skill covers React Router v6 patterns including useNavigate, useParams, and nested routes.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with TypeScript?
faq.answer: All code examples use TypeScript syntax including proper type annotations for hooks and components.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use in production?
faq.answer: This skill contains documentation only. The code patterns shown follow official React Router and Next.js documentation.

faq.question: Does this skill require any dependencies?
faq.answer: No dependencies required. The skill provides reference patterns only - install react-router-dom or use Next.js built-in routing.

faq.question: How does this compare to reading official docs?
faq.answer: This skill curates common patterns with working code examples. Use official docs for complete API reference and edge cases.
